title: Shepherd Murape
text:
Shepherd Murape is a Zimbabwean <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> who currently manages South African club <a href="Magesi%20F.C.">Magesi</a>.
Career.
Murape played club football for <a href="Harare">Harare</a> side <a href="Dynamos%20F.C.">Dynamos F.C.</a> and for the <a href="Zimbabwe%20national%20football%20team">Zimbabwe national football team</a>.
In 1976, he became a player-manager for Dynamos, and helped lead the club to several league titles. He went on to manage newly formed <a href="Black%20Rhinos%20F.C.">Black Rhinos F.C.</a> in 1983.
Murape has had stints with <a href="Free%20State%20Stars%20F.C.">QwaQwa Stars F.C.</a>, Real Rovers F.C., <a href="AmaZulu%20F.C.">AmaZulu F.C.</a>, <a href="Moroka%20Swallows%20F.C.">Moroka Swallows F.C.</a>, <a href="Black%20Leopards%20F.C.">Black Leopards F.C.</a>, <a href="Orlando%20Pirates%20F.C.">Orlando Pirates F.C.</a> and <a href="Manning%20Rangers%20F.C.">Manning Rangers F.C.</a> in South Africa. He led <a href="Blue%20Waters%20F.C.">Blue Waters F.C.</a> to the Namibian league title in 2004.
Murape managed the <a href="Zimbabwe%20national%20football%20team">Zimbabwe national football team</a> during 1981. In 1994, he became the first person to manage <a href="Namibia%20national%20football%20team">Namibia national football team</a> following its independence.
Murape was appointed manager of South African <a href="National%20First%20Division">National First Division</a> club <a href="Magesi%20F.C.">Magesi</a> in October 2016.
